reviewText:
8.8/10 – Pixel Graphics Taken to the Next Level!

I always enjoy some good pixel graphics; but this game showed me you can do more with it than I imagined! The gameplay is fluid and action based. You control helicopters moving into the warzone to pick up wounded soldiers, equipment and ammunitions over 25 progressively challenging levels.

There are 4 different helicopters to unlock; the last being that sexy Chinook! Each time you upgrade your helicopter your capacity, armor and guns get better but your overall control greatly diminishes. The music and graphics are both well done and exceeded my expectations; I didn't realize the level of shadows and lighting detail that could be achieved with something like this. I dig it.

It's worth the $4; but definitely grab on sale if this sounds like your thing!

reviewText: This is a fabulous little game (4.5 out of 5), reminding me of a mix of Choplifter, Fort Apocalypse and a little Desert Strike, with bright colors and a nice 2.5D voxel-look. This game is among my current top favorites. It allows for a quick round or two-three trying to complete a map/mission, so is quite inviting for casual play. The controls need a little getting used to, but once you've finished one or two maps they do feel natural and add to the feel of the game (I'm using gamepad controls).\n\nBasically there are two styles" of play
date: sometimes mixed in one mission: what I would call "normal flight" where one rescues soldier or brings in equipment while bringing down or avoiding enemy fire
recommended: and "fort apocalypse" mode where one navigates the heli through cavernous parts. There are in total 25 maps/missions for now. My favorites are the ones that require a little planning on taking down the enemy in the right order to be able to survive the mission. I care a little less for the "fort apocalypse" parts because I like flying that chopper
hoursPlayed: not inching forward (although once more practised
voteText: one can fly through caves with higher speed).\n\nCompletionists can try to finish every mission for silver or gold medals
helpfulPercent: and collect up to five extra items per mission that give rise to soldier dog tags. I feel the game is fun enough to attempt this.\n\nThe game has a cool intro screen by the way
votesHelpful: with the heli blades spinning in slomo. Bottom line: recommended!\n"

reviewText:
So far I'm enjoying this. Old school Choplifter in a Minecraft setting.  Simple aim is to fly helicopter, with very limited controls, and rescue troops and vehicles from enemy territory. You may need to shoot and/or avoid enemies at times as well. Charming with  cool physics.

The controls are what will make you love or hate this game. Much like the old Lunar Lander/Thrust/Oids type games, you can only control left thrust, right thrust or both at the same time which makes you feel like you are trying to balance on a bowling ball. I enjoy the challenge, reminds me somewhat of the old Desert Combat Apache controls. But when it gets windy, it becomes extremely challenging to control, especially if you have the controls set to the professional option.

I nice diversion from all the modern popular 3d shooters everywhere, and a game that requires a bit of hand eye coordination.

reviewText: This game, (For those of you who don't know) was and still is a mobile game. It was ported,  but it got updates to it so you can keybind and all that goodness. I do sort of like it, but I wouldn't play through all 25 levels unless it was the only game I had installed and had no internet. The controls are a bit clunky when turning because it turns you SO for over that you can sometimes crash into a tree without going very far up first. To go straight up, you have to press your laft and right buttons at the same time. The shooting is a little odd felling if you have your keys binded to for right on your keyboard, unless you have auto mode on. I give this game a 5/10 because I kind of want a refund. (ERGH STEAM)

reviewText: Dustoff Heli Rescue has you flying through a war zone trying to save your troops and your equipment.  At times you'll need to rescue a certain number of troops somewhere on the map and other times pick up and bring home your equipment such as vehicles.  The maps are 3D, retro block style graphics.  The graphics actually aren't bad and are handled well in this game.  The flight patterns are only up and down vertically and left and right horizontally.  There is no real 3D space to fly around in.  Some people have complained about the handling of the helicopter.  While it's true the controls are very simple and can't be changed, the controls are very simple to get used to and allow you full control of the helicopter at all times.  This doesn't mean that the game isn't tricky when controlling your helicopter through tank ammunition, rockets and caves.  The difficulty level increases as you progress through your 25 missions, but I never found the game too frustrating or overly difficult at all.  Easy 100% achievement if you're into that kind of stuff.  Definitely a fun game to play and definitely would recommend it for the right price, $2.50 or less.

reviewText: I love helicopter games generally. I saw this one a couple of weeks ago and thought it might be ok and added it to my Wishlist. It was on a deep discount today so I dug deeper and read some reviews. I don't know how much they may have updated the game since some of the bad reviews but I was able to turn the music off and also fly with the shoulder buttons on my 360 controller. The aiming can also be set to manual but I didn't have much luck getting any of the remaining 360 buttons or sticks to control the crosshair. So manual control of the crosshair is out for me. I like the game a lot and ran through several missions during my first hour of play. I can now fly 2 of the 3 choppers and have 2 of the 3 guns unlocked. The game is challenging when the wind is blowing hard and I laugh everytime I crash because it was usually my own fault. Overall this is an entertaining game and worth every penny I paid, 59 pennies exactly!

reviewText:
Great little game. It might be a mobile port, but as long as it's enjoyable to play, and this is definitely the case, I don't care ;)

Been playing for 4 hours, made it to level 16 of 25 (unless there are some bonus levels after that) with (so far) all gold medals and all bonuses (dog tags to find, scattered around the levels). I'm using an xbox360 controller, and that works perfectly (I did not even try with keyboard).

I remained on easy mode for flying (I think pro mode just brings frustration, not what I'm after), and auto fire, though manual fire could be useful on some levels (come to think of it, I don't think I'm able to change that in the options ... so far at least).

The overall feeling of flying is quite good for such a game imho, the levels have been interesting up to now, and the achievements are very doable, for the most part. Only complaint I have : the dog tags bonuses are really difficult to spot sometimes, leading to some wandering around the maps for quite some time, to find the damn last one ;)

The price is right, the game is enjoyable, there are trading cards and achievements : this game is totally recomended, even if it's only 10 hours long or so (I'll know exactly later ...)

UPDATE : game finished in a little more than 7 hours. The last level is a real challenge, don't expect a medal with autofire on (and to clarify, this means you'll have to play this one on keyboard + mouse, controller unplugged, the option to turn off autofire is not available otherwise). So, maybe a bit on the short side, but still very much recommended :)

date: where the cargo gets out of control & starts revolving around the chopper. This is due to the game's physics

reviewText: Escort missions are lame, but rescue missions are fun - and that's exactly what this is.  Swoop in, get the troops, swoop out.  You can often even do it without fighting, in a nice little turn-the-paradigm-on-its-head.\n\nIt's surprisingly fun and has a decent amount of challenge.  The graphics aren't amazing, but they're serviceable.  I was a little surprised, but this one is definitely worth recommending.

Easily one of the best games I've accidentally found on steam.

It's only got 25 missions sure, but within them is an array of intense tasks that will easily be worth your money, Whether you are battling the VC, the weather or testing your skills flying through a cave this game keeps you hooked.

reviewText:
A fun game where you control a Helicopter and either seek out and rescue allied soldiers by landing next to them, or by simply destroying stuff like bunkers, tanks, and sometimes other Helicopters with your mounted Machine gun.

There are various ways to extend game time, such as trying to complete the level in the least amount time possible, finding the Dog tags hidden in levels, and also retying levels with different Helicopters and Guns. There are 3 different Helicopters and 3 different Guns, each behaving a different way.

Along with the basic controls(Up, down, left, right, shoot), there's a Pro" control scheme for flying
date: which it behaves more realistically physics wise.\n\nI recommend this game to anyone who likes those Lunar Lander type rescue games
recommended: or anyone who likes some 'copter combat."

reviewText: A great but simple game. You must pilot a helicopter through enemy fire and rescue soldiers in sometimes hard to reach places. On its most basic settings the guns are automated and flight is controlled with only 2 buttons.  There are currently 25 missions. With 4 hours into the game I have completed everry level at silver or above. I have 6 yet to get gold medals in. I will be going back to get them. There are also 5 dog tags to collect on each level, but I feel less driven to find all of those.  Missions are short and sweet usually 5 minutes to complete, never more than 10. It makes for a great time waster between chores or when nagging roomates are nearby. It has been a fun, bug free game, great to waste a few minutes or a whole afternoon.

reviewText:
4/10.

Apparently developer's friends reviewed this, as only way I can see it has a positive rating.

Clear mobile port ripoff. No resolution changes. No customizable controls. Uses arrow keys (in 2015, rly?) and mouse and is super annoying to use. Every level the same. You just fly side to side on this same looking small map that has trees and a few areas where you pick up guys and bring them back. That is it, the entire game. You get 3 total weapons, 2 of which are just machine guns. The controls suck. One button moves 1 way, 1 moves the other, hold both same time to rise. Sometimes I would press sideways then press to the other side and my helicopter would just flip all the way over. Sometimes you just tap it and it overcorrects. You commonly catch a side when you are landing and just flip over. Graphics are terrible minecraft ripoff. You have to pick up guys in water but water deals damage to you for some unknown reason. There are trees, but its impossible to tell which are in your plane of map and which are behind or in front. The ones in front block your view when you need to land, leading to you to flip over, which is a stupid design decision. Barely tapping down hurts your helicopter somehow. This is just a repetitive uninventive bare-bones mobile port. Cute little guys you pick up though.

reviewText:
The year is 1942. World War has reared it's ugly head upon the vastness of the jungle not unlike the graphics presentation in this game. An evil alien cube called the Mindcraft has taken over half of the known universe thus turning everything into blocks. Only you and your trusty helicopter named Lucy can save the entire galaxy from the horrors of having a square shaped bowel movement.

This game is a documentary about a famous war hero. Complete with highly advanced augmentations left over from a mentally challenged rodent, the A.I in this game is more than ground breaking. At times you will find yourself going only sideways. This is because the known world has been turned into a psuedo-3D by the smoking ruins of monkey urine.

War is an expensive business. Your assignment is to rescue the sole survivors of the jungle and free them from the clutches of an warlord known as I Have Under 75 Cents Maybe I Should Buy This Game". You might be thinking that's a strange name. The last person who questioned it is now cleaning the latrine with Q-tips until further notice.

Upon the journey for survival and rescue
date: this game also includes magic. This is because your chopper will suddenly make it's way into the ground
recommended: welcoming you to an early death for no reason. Other times
hoursPlayed: you will find crates of supplies which are strangely attracted to the roters. Although invisible
voteText: this magic is the essence of the once great city known as Steam.\n\nThat once great city of Steam did it's best for it's people
helpfulPercent:
but failed to stop games of this quality from reaching the known galaxy. It is up to you to decide. Support the war effort by not being involved or miserably fail trying to free the world from the grip of Mindcraft.

Pros:

Under $1 dollar
No DLC

Cons:
Under $1 dollar
No co-op
The A.I of extinct species are smarter
This game being allowed to exist in the known dimension of space and time

No story. Make your own"

reviewText:
Dustoff Heli Rescue is a simple retro arcade kick back with some interesting maps and features.  The premise is simple; rescue soldiers or collect and return items.  The variables are enemy's firing at you, the elements and the ability to land properly.  The gameplay is decent and you can invest a decent chunk of time into trying to master the controls.  It offers several stages with different difficulties and overall it is an enjoyable and positive experience.  If you are into arcade style games then this will fit nicely in your library.  The best part is the cost is relatively low and it hits a super discount quite frequently.

I've included a video.  It is not a review.  It is a longplay of the first 12 missions.  Have a great day! :)
https://youtu.be/nDs_0186n4o

reviewText:
Dustoff Heli Rescue is a simple retro arcade kick back with some interesting maps and features.  The premise is simple; rescue soldiers or collect and return items.  The variables are enemy's firing at you, the elements and the ability to land properly.  The gameplay is decent and you can invest a decent chunk of time into trying to master the controls.  It offers several stages with different difficulties and overall it is an enjoyable and positive experience.  If you are into arcade style games then this will fit nicely in your library.  The best part is the cost is relatively low and it hits a super discount quite frequently.

I've included a video.  It is not a review.  It is a longplay of the first 12 missions.  Have a great day! :)
https://youtu.be/nDs_0186n4o

reviewText: First off, this game DOES NOT have full controller support.  I may consider changing my recommendation once the label is fixed.  It does have partial support.\n\nThe game itself is sort of fun, though you can tell it is clearly a mobile port.  It's on sale right now for $.59 and totally worth that, but I'm not sure about the normal 4 dollar price tag.

reviewText: Anyone nastalgic for Choplifter should find enjoyment here. I wouldn't recommend paying more than $2-$3 dollars for it, though. It has a simple control scheme, charming voxel graphics, and gameplay that shines in the wide open maps. When it comes to navigating caverns, however, things can get frustrating. I did complete all the missions in this game, and paid less than a dollar for it. I definitely got bang for my buck.

reviewText:
I really wanted to like this game because I enjoyed Choplifter as a kid but a few issues really dragged down the fun out of it for me.

-odd controls.  L and R for left and right,  hold both to ascend and let go to decend. Would rather just use the joystick to move and two fave buttons to ascend and decend instead.
-super touchy collision. If your heli gets turned slightly the wrong way boom you're dead.
-extra unlockable helis actually control *worse*. Yes they may have more person capacity and a higher health bar but controls are even more touchy than before especially on higher stages going into caverns and whatnot where space is tight.
-you have to land *extremely* softly.  Otherwise you lose a ton of health or worse yet- you explode.

I do like the voxel graphics though. Music and the pilot chatter are nice additions as well. The touchy and weird controls along with poor heli selections just kill the fun.
